moves.1. d4: Victory snatched from the jaws of defeat! this game shows why sometimes it pays not to resign even when in a bad situation.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 h6: i think this opponent has done some homework and spotted that I've been playing the Torre attack a lot recently. h6 prevents my usual 3.Bg5
moves.3. e3: ...so I'll try something different this time.
moves.3... Bg4: nice pin on knight. I like to play this move.
moves.4. Nbd2: to maintain knight on f3 is exchange is played.
moves.4... Nf6 5. h3: don't like that bishop hanging around there!
moves.5... Bh5 6. Be2 e6 7. c3 Bd6 8. Ne5: if Bxe5 exchange is taken white will gain a material advantage so Bxe2 likely here.
moves.9. Qxe2 Bxe5 10. dxe5: the game is somewhat simplified now but I'm not too happy with my position after these exchanges.
moves.10... Nfd7 11. O-O Nxe5: oops! forgot to defend the pawn. Big mistake and now I'm material down.
moves.13... Qf6 14. e4: intending attack on queen with 15.e5 or 14.dxe4 15.Nxe4
moves.18... b6: but easy to defend, however blacks c6 knight now under pressure
moves.20... Ne7 21. Rf3: Re5 may be better option. comments welcome...
moves.23. c4 Nf6 24. Bf4: looking to bring other rook into play. in hindsight I don't like this move!
moves.24... Nbd7 25. h4: defending knight to allow bishop to change direction and attack f rook
moves.25... Nc5: good move. prevents c pawn advancing and chases queen from dangerous position.
moves.26. Qe3 Rfe8 27. Qf2 Ng4 28. Qf1: queen on the run! good pressure from black.
moves.28... f6 29. Nh3: only safe square for the knight. good pressure from black.
moves.29... Ne6 30. Bd6: walking into danger! bad move by me!
moves.30... Nd4: black's knights are very well positioned! lots of danger for white to think about now. f3 rook in big trouble, can be forked by d4 knight in many possible situations. 31.Ne2  is of particular concern.
moves.31. Nf4: calculated risk by me here. if 31.Nxf3 I can play 32.gxf3 then gain g4 knight after queen moves to safety. however black can move queen to safety first. Moving my knight to f4 does however cover danger square e2.
moves.32. Rd3: rook can now move here safely as danger of Ne2  then Qxd3 is removed
moves.32... c5 33. b4: trying to make an escape for stranded bishop on d6
moves.33... Nc2 34. Rc1 Nxb4 35. Ra3 a5 36. Bc: escape now impossible forbishop. have to be bold and go for attack.
moves.37. Rg3: planning Nxh5 next to put pressure on g7
moves.37... Qxc7 38. Nxh5 Qf7: I think Qd7 would have been better for black here.
moves.39. Nxg7: if knight exchange taken i gain a pawn. risky when material down but little else open to me.
moves.39... Qxg7 40. Qf4: black must move king or queen or looses queen.
picking off a few pawn could help things later.
moves.45... Kg7 46. Qxc5: perhaps Rxf6 would be better but black could respond with Qxh4.
moves.47. Qd4: pressure back on f6 and pawn pinned.
moves.52. g3: mistake. pinned rook in danger of Nd3
moves.52... Nd3: I am in serious trouble. f2 rook is dead, how can i make the best out of a bad situation? nearly resigned at this stage until I spotted a speculative last throw of the dice...
moves.53. Qc2: ...this was the move. Will end up a rook down after 53.Qxf2  54.Qxf2 54.Nxf2 55.Kxf2. this would be effectively game over, but if black fails to spot danger and plays Nxf2 first then I have the winning move 54.Qh7
moves.53... Nxf2: wow! black didn't spot the danger! what a mistake!!
moves.54. Qh7+ Ke8 55. Rg8#: What an escape this was for me! I deserved to loose this game from an early stage, but somehow snatched victory when I was on the verge of defeat.
